Name: ComparisonName
Description: A name for the comparison. May be expressed in multiple languages. Repeat the element to express names with different content, for example different names for different systems.

Name: Label
Description: A display label for the comparison. May be expressed in multiple languages. Repeat for labels with different content, for example, labels with differing length limitations.

Name: Description
Description: A description of the content and purpose of the comparison. May be expressed in multiple languages and supports the use of structured content.

Name: ConceptMapReference
Description: Maps the content of two different concept schemes of objects of the same type providing detail for the comparable items within those two schemes.

Name: VariableMapReference
Description: Maps the content of two different variable schemes of objects of the same type providing detail for the comparable items within those two schemes.

Name: QuestionMapReference
Description: Maps the content of two different question schemes of objects of the same type providing detail for the comparable items within those two schemes.

Name: CategoryMapReference
Description: Maps the content of two different category schemes of objects of the same type providing detail for the comparable items within those two schemes.

Name: RepresentationMapReference
Description: Maps between any two managed representations. In addition to representation types held in a ManagedRepresentationScheme, managed representations include CategoryScheme and coded representations which include CodeList, GeographicStructureCode or GeographicLocationCode. Note that the source can be any managed representation including a CodeList, GeographicStructure or GeographicLocation. Note that comparisons between two category schemes is best handled by CategoryMap.

Name: UniverseMapReference
Description: Maps the content of two different universe schemes of objects of the same type providing detail for the comparable items within those two schemes.
